abstract.p: Westchester County (NY) District Attorney Jeanine Pirro recommends changing system used to bill municipalities that dispose of waste under countract with county, particularly those that use private haulers (S)

block.p: District Attorney Jeanine Pirro has recommended changing the system used for billing municipalities that dispose of waste under contract with the county -- particularly those using private haulers to collect and dump refuse. Her recommendations followed the sentencing early this month of a garbage carter who overbilled the town of Ossining by $70,000. Mrs. Pirro's suggestions include a system of computerized I.D. cards issued for all commercial haulers and municipal accounts, to be used by drivers weighing in and out at the dump.
